pros: This is a purpose driven organization where everyone is here to make an impact. Hours and work location are very flexible and there is a great vacation package.
cons: A lot of recent organization changes. Headed in the right direction but still some growing pains.

pros: Exposure to exciting and innovative companies and technology. Some of the companies are really cool and their visions are inspiring. There are also some very smart and knowledgable people who work here.
cons: Really poor leadership and not a clear strategy for the organization. It's shocking that for an organization that is meant to support innovation and supposedly values things like equity, diversity, and inclusion that they are so dysfunctional and easily turn a blind eye to fundamental cultural issues happening right under their nose. Unfortunately this seems to happen all the time: organizations proclaim that they care about things, but underneath the surface they don't live by those values at all. There are cases where it is known that particular people are responsible for poor morale and high turnover and HR and other leaders consistently turn a blind eye. It's a highly political place and if you are one of the favourites of certain senior leaders then you seemingly don't need to be accountable for your behaviour or job performance. Some of the people designated as leaders in the organization for building internal capacity for inclusion and creating a safe space are simultaneously treating people poorly. It's so ridiculous it's almost comical. Whether you have a good experience working here is heavily dependent on your particular team and manager and if they can shelter you from the dysfunction and issues trickling down from the senior leadership level.

pros: good work environment, friendly, chill
cons: pay is low, division between departments are harsh

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Toronto, ON
pros: Good working environment. Fun team
cons: Not applicable good place to work

pros: Benefits, time off policy, hybrid policy
cons: Funding status constantly under review. Lots of stakeholders.

review_title: Has potential depending on your role
job_title: Corporate Services Worker in Toronto, ON
pros:
4 weeks vacation + 1 day extra on every long weekend in the summer + time off when the office closes between xmas & New Year. Staff are encouraged to take that time for themselves and not work during time off. Bonus based
on financial performance of the organization+your performance. Good colleagues and a very interesting organization and clients. Challenging work.
cons: While the organization goes through the motions of inclusion, equity and transparency, you soon learn it ends there. Similar to larger organizations Senior Executives approve increases/promotions for themselves while the belt tightening impacts those in middle management down. Unless you are in a high profile department the value of your role may not be understood thereby limiting your career path.

review_title: There should be more places like MaRS DD on planet earth
pros:
Frontier talent in the innovation/impact space. Great place to learn the ins and outs of the innovation ecosystem.
Fresh faces and exciting new structure, to drive growth and scale. Great time to be part of the organization as it gears up for it's next phase. Also enjoying very supportive ops and HR.
Welcoming and warm leadership team with depth of experience.
cons: Expected growing pains which come with change.

pros: Great organization to work at

pros: MaRS is a great place to start your career and gain a lot of skills quickly.
cons: Stay too long though, and you'll quickly find it difficult to navigate the politics, shifting executive leadership and frequent re-orgs into the role you want.

review_title: Great learning opportunity - not a long term organization
pros: The organization offers significant responsibility to junior employees which pushes people to learn, adapt and grow quickly.
cons: The environment is stressful, young employees are often stuck with a large amount of the work and senior management is highly toxic.

pros: Its a great place if you are starting your career
cons: Unclear direction of the company/priorities

review_title: Great connections and mission, poor top level leadership, little actual entrepreneurial experience inside organization
pros: Passionate people with shared sense of mission supporting innovation economy in Canada; great connector for founders and entrepreneurs
cons: Poor leadership and little actual understanding of entrepreneurial experience and DNA; too focused on PR with little substance; need to behave and think less like a political lobby

pros: group companies provides different types of service
cons: it doesn't have any cons

review_title: Great staff, cool building, amazing networking opportunities, poor management
pros:
The staff are great - lots of intelligent and inspiring people to work with and numerous social events throughout the year to connect with each other. If you connect with the right employees, there are opportunities to create and work on exciting and fulfilling projects. 

The ability to work with entrepreneurs and help them achieve their business goals is also fantastic and rewarding. 

The benefit of working in the MaRS building is the opportunity to connect with many people/companies in the startup community as well as the ability to attend a vast number of free education events throughout the year in the building. 

Salary tends to be low (except if you're in senior management) but the benefits package is not bad.
cons:
There is a lack of transparency in business operations as well as between business units. Time and resources are often wasted because different groups are doing the same work rather than working together due to the lack of structural overview and poor communication. 

There is also an expectation to work long hours for small salaries and no overtime compensation. There has been a salary freeze for the past 2+ years yet senior management continue to get promotions allowing them to increase their salaries without it being considered a raise. If you're lucky enough to have a supportive manager, you may be provided with lieu time, but it's not an official policy and it doesn't happen often. 

For non-senior management staff there is little to no room for promotions and a raise is rarely given.

review_title: Great place to network and learn
pros: Lots of smart people in the ecosystem
cons: Not a place to make money

pros:
- Working with founders and tech startups
- Gain great connections in Canadian innovation community
- MaRS does great work
cons: - Non-profit environment may not suit everybody

pros: Flexible shifts, best co worker
cons: Inconsistent working hours, sometimes can have OT

review_title: Short term focus, political, very dependent on grant funding
pros: Interesting work, hires over-qualified employees
cons: Short term focus, political, very dependent on grant funding

review_title: Great Flexibility and people ,but no room for growth
pros:
MaRS has great flexibility and benefits. You are surrounded by thought leaders and get to work with and interact with many people. Being in the building you also have an upper hand in networking as the building houses some large companies like Paypal and Facebook but also many small emerging start ups.
Also there are always tons of events going on meaning you attend many conferences and events for free if you register and not to mention you will have lots of free food available through out the year. 
The BEST part about MaRS are the MaRSians. Generally a younger crowd that work hard and play hard and there are always many internal events to allow you to meet others, interact and have fun while working.
cons:
Salaries are low compared to industry and there isn't much room to grow at MaRS. Because of this the turn over rate is 2 years. You will see a lot of people come and go. 

Also the work life balance is a bit poor depending on your department and/or manager.

pros:
The organization had its time in the sun several years ago (2016/17), and since then constant reorganization and turn over has affected the performance, efficiency and impact of the work and projects. 

Overall great people
Flexible working hours (though, dependent on business units, and varies across managers)
Meaningful work
Customer/client focused
Entrepreneurial behaviour is rewarded
cons:
Information to improve (formally and informally collected) has been given only lip service. 
There is little to no accountability.  
Those who are successful bear the weight of more responsibility with marginal support or incentive
Uncertainty around sustainability of the business and business model. 
Lack of transparency on decision making. 
Lack of communication between senior leadership and lower levels of the organization. 
Great deal of learned helplessness by junior staff. 
Aggressive entrepreneurial behavior is rewarded. 
Silos between business units and teams

review_title: Good but could be great...it's time for a change.
pros: Vibrant exciting atmosphere which promotes innovative thinking on a global scale. Well recognized as a leader in the incubator marketplace.
cons: Few if any growth opportunities and promotions are based on who you know versa what you know.  A very political organization because of senior management attitudes and  government funding. It is run like a a typical government department, big slow, cumbersome and with too many personal political agendas. Relies heavily on what has been done in the past.

pros:
- You get exposed to the most cutting edge innovations 
- You can network with tons of people and attend great events
- You will learn A LOT and be exposed to A LOT
cons:
- Not many opportunities for permanent employment
- Not many opportunities for promotions - sort of a flat organization. 
- Hires externally for higher up, management positions, thus making it difficult to work your way up from within.

pros:
- Some interesting companies that are here, and a select upper management that are experienced outside of the company. 
- Good internal team - HR/IT/Marketing
cons:
- Strategy of the company not correct, motivation and focus is around administration not what the "mission" is.
- High turnover rate due to low salary and ill-defined jobs, younger or newer talented staff will want to leave 
- Some staff are complacent and lazy in upper levels to innovate in a meaningful or valuable way, ie -a bit fluffy.

pros: Amazingly smart, enlightened, purpose-driven leaders and employees;agreat feeling of being part of something big, important and impactful; so many interesting and exciting things constantly going on.
cons: Need to do constantly work on enhancing collaboration and alignment; always a bit resource constrained due to being a non- profit; need to follow many government governance processes ( like expense management and procurement) which can be a bit cumbersome and heavy for a small organization such as Mars

cons: Not a con really, but the multi-faceted scope can be challenging to navigate, both outside and inside, so it's important to be flexible and resourceful
